Groups.Group: Dimmer 2 operation - Active power and energy reports

Parameter.Title: Minimum brightness level
Parameter.Description: percentage level of brightness (parameter is set automatically during the calibration process). The parameter can be changed manually after the calibration.

Parameter.Title: Maximum brightness level
Parameter.Description: percentage level of brightness (parameter is set automatically during the calibration process). The parameter can be changed manually after the calibration.

Parameter.Title: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Parameter.Description: Virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The Dimmer 2 will set to this value after first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources.

Parameter.Title: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Parameter.Description: This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality.

Parameter.Title: Automatic control - dimming step size
Parameter.Description: This parameter defines the percentage value of dimming step during the automatic control.

Parameter.Title: Automatic control - time of a dimming step
Parameter.Description: This parameter defines the time of single dimming step set in parameter 5 during the automatic control.

Parameter.Title: Manual control - dimming step size
Parameter.Description: This parameter defines the percentage value of dimming step during the manual control.

Parameter.Title: Manual control - time of a dimming step
Parameter.Description: This parameter defines the time of single dimming step set in parameter 7 during the manual control.

Parameter.Title: State of the device after a power failure
Parameter.Description: The Dimmer 2 will return to the last state before power failure. 0 - the Dimmer 2 does not save the state before a power failure, it returns to „off” position 1 - the Dimmer 2 restores its state before power failure

Parameter.Title: Timer functionality (auto - off)
Parameter.Description: This parameter allows to automatically switch off the device after specified time from switching on the light source. It may be useful when the Dimmer 2 is installed in the stairway. 0 - Function disabled 1-32767 - time to turn off measured in seconds (1s-9.1h)

Parameter.Title: ALL ON/ALL OFF function
Parameter.Description: Parameter allows for activation/deactivation of Z-Wave commands enabling/disabling all devices located in direct range of the main controller. 0 - ALL ON not active, ALL OFF not active 1 - ALL ON not active, ALL OFF active 2 - ALL ON active, ALL OFF not active 255 - ALL ON active, ALL OFF active

Parameter.Title: Force auto-calibration
Parameter.Description: Changing value of this parameter will force the calibration process. During the calibration parameter is set to 1 or 2 and switched to 0 upon completion. 0 - readout 1 - force auto-calibration of the load without FIBARO Bypass 2 2 - force auto-calibration of the load with FIBARO Bypass 2

Parameter.Title: Auto-calibration status
Parameter.Description: This parameter determines operating mode of the Dimmer 2 (auto-matic/manual settings). 0 - calibration procedure not performed or Dim-mer 2 operates on manual settings 1 - Dimmer 2 operates on auto-calibration settings

Parameter.Title: Burnt out bulb detection
Parameter.Description: Function based on the sudden power variation of a specific value, in-terpreted as a LOAD ERROR. 0 - function disabled 1-99 - percentage value of power variation, compared to standard power consumption, measured during the calibration procedure (to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb)

Parameter.Title: Time delay of a burnt out bulb (parameter 15) or overload (parameter 39) detection
Parameter.Description: Time of delay (in seconds) for power variation detection, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR or OVERLOAD detection (too much power connect-ed to the Dimmer 2). 0 - detection of a burnt out bulb disabled 1-255 - delay time in seconds .

Parameter.Title: Forced switch on brightness level
Parameter.Description: If the parameter is active, switching on the Dimmer 2 (S1 single click) will always set this brightness level. 0 - function disabled 1-99 - percentage level of brightness

Parameter.Title: Switch type
Parameter.Description: Choose between momentary, toggle and roller blind switch. 0 - momentary switch 1 - toggle switch 2 - roller blind switch - two switches operate the Dimmer 2 (S1 to brighten, S2 to dim)

Parameter.Title: The value sent to associated devices on single click
Parameter.Description: This parameter defines the value sent to devices associated with Dim-mer 2 after its enabling. 0 - 0xFF value is sent, which will set associated devices to their last saved state 1 -current Dimmer 2 state is sent, which will synchronize brightness level of associated devices (other dimmers for example)

Parameter.Title: Assign toggle switch status to the device status
Parameter.Description: By default each change of toggle switch position results in action of Dimmer 2 (switch on/off ) regardless the physical connection of conntacts. 0 - device changes status on switch status change 1 - device status is synchronized with switch status

Parameter.Title: Double click option - set the brightness level to MAX
Parameter.Description: 0 - double click disabled 1 - double click enabled

Parameter.Title: Command frames sent in 2nd and 3rd association groups (S1 associations)
Parameter.Description: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups. 0 - all actions send to association groups 1 - do not send when switching On (single click) 2 - do not send when switching OFF (single click) 4 - do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing) 8 - do not send on double click 16 - send 0xFF value on double click

Parameter.Title: Command frames sent in 4th and 5th association groups (S2 associations)
Parameter.Description: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups. 0 - all actions send to association groups 1 - do not send when switching On (single click) 2 - do not send when switching OFF (single click) 4 - do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing) 8 - do not send on double click 16 - send 0xFF value on double click

Parameter.Title: The function of 3-way switch
Parameter.Description: Switch no. 2 controls the Dimmer 2 additionally (in 3-way switch mode). Function disabled for parameter 20 set to 2 (roller blind switch). 0 - 3-way switch function for S2 disabled 1 - 3-way switch function for S2 enabled

Parameter.Title: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Parameter.Description: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified asso-ciation groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline group. 0 - all groups (II-V) sent as non-secure 1 - 2nd group sent as secure 2 - 3rd group sent as secure 4 - 4th group sent as secure 8 - 5th group sent as secure 15 - all groups (II-V) sent as secure

Parameter.Title: Scene activation functionality
Parameter.Description: SCENE ID depends on the switch type configurations. 0 - functionality deactivated 1 - functionality activated

Parameter.Title: Switch functionality of S1 and S2
Parameter.Description: This parameter allows for switching the role of keys connected to S1 and S2 without changes in connection. 0 - standard mode 1 - S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

Parameter.Title: Load control mode
Parameter.Description: This parameter allows to set the desired load control mode. The de-vice automatically adjusts correct control mode, but the installer may force its change using this parameter.Forced auto-calibration will set this parameter’s value to 2. 0 - forced leading edge control 1 - forced trailing edge control 2 - control mode selected automatically (based on auto-calibration)

Parameter.Title: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration
Parameter.Description: 0 - leading edge 1 - trailing edge

Parameter.Title: On/Off mode
Parameter.Description: This mode is necessary while connecting non-dimmable light sources. Setting this parameter to 1 automatically ignores brightening/dimming time settings. Forced auto-calibration will set this parame-ter’s value to 2. 0 - on/off mode disabled (dimming is possible) 1 - on/off mode enabled (dimming is not pos-sible) 2 - mode selected automatically

Parameter.Title: Dimmability of the load (read only)
Parameter.Description: This parameter contains an information about possibility of dimming the load detected during calibration procedure. 0 - Load recognized as dimmable 1 - Load recognized as non-dimmable

Parameter.Title: Soft-Start functionality
Parameter.Description: Time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb. 0 - no soft-start 1 - short soft-start (0.1s) 2 - long soft-start (0.5s)

Parameter.Title: Auto-calibration after power on
Parameter.Description: This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc. 0 - no auto-calibration of the load after power on 1 - Auto-calibration performed after first power on 2 - Auto-calibration performed after each power on 3 - Auto-calibration performed after first power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), if parameter 37 is set to 1 also after alarms: SURGE (Dimmer 2 out-put overvoltage) and OVERCuRREnT (Dimmer 2 output overcurrent) 4 - Auto-calibration performed after each pow-er on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), if parameter 37 is set to 1 also after alarms: SURGE (Dimmer 2 out-put overvoltage) and OVERCURRENT (Dimmer 2 output overcurrent)

Parameter.Title: Behaviour of the Dimmer 2 after OVERCURRENT or SURGE
Parameter.Description: Occuring of errors related to surge or overcurrent results in turning off the output to prevent possible malfunction. By default the device performs three attempts to turn on the load (useful in case of momentary, short failures of the power supply). 0 - device permanently disabled until re-enabling by command or external switch 1 - three attempts to turn on the load

Parameter.Title: Power limit - OVERLOAD
Parameter.Description: Reaching the defined value will result in turning off the load. Addi-tional apparent power limit of 350VA is active by default. Note: Parameter 39 is relevant only when parameter 58 is set to 0. 0 - functionality disabled 1-350 - 1-350W

Parameter.Title: Response to General Purpose Alarm
Parameter.Description: 0 - no reaction 1 - Turn on the load 2 - Turn off the load 3 - Load blinking

Parameter.Title: Response to Water Flooding Alarm
Parameter.Description: 0 - no reaction 1 - Turn on the load 2 - Turn off the load 3 - Load blinking

Parameter.Title: Response to Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm
Parameter.Description: 0 - no reaction 1 - Turn on the load 2 - Turn off the load 3 - Load blinking

Parameter.Title: Response to Temperature Alarm
Parameter.Description: 0 - no reaction 1 - Turn on the load 2 - Turn off the load 3 - Load blinking

Parameter.Title: Time of alarm state
Parameter.Description: 1-32767 - time of alarm state measured in seconds (1s-9.1h) Note: Alarm state may be cancelled earlier, as a result of pressing the switch or sending the Z-Wave command frame.

Parameter.Title: OVERLOAD alarm report
Parameter.Description: Load power consumption too high 0 - no reaction 1 - Send an alarm frame

Parameter.Title: LOAD ERROR alarm report
Parameter.Description: No load, load failure, burnt out bulb 0 - no reaction 1 - Send an alarm frame

Parameter.Title: OVERCURRENT alarm report
Parameter.Description: Short circuit, burnt out bulb causing overcurrent 0 - no reaction 1 - Send an alarm frame

Parameter.Title: SURGE alarm report
Parameter.Description: Dimmer 2 output overvoltage 0 - no reaction 1 - Send an alarm frame

Parameter.Title: OVERHEAT and VOLTAGE DROP alarm report
Parameter.Description: OVERHEAT (critical temperature) and VOLTAGE DROP (low volt-age) 0 - no reaction 1 - Send an alarm frame

Parameter.Title: Active power reports
Parameter.Description: The parameter defines the power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. 0 - power reports disabled 1-100 (1-100%) - power report threshold

Parameter.Title: Periodic active power and energy reports
Parameter.Description: Parameter 52 defines a time period between consecutive reports. Timer is reset and counted from zero after each report. 0 - periodic reports disabled 1-32767 (1-32767 seconds)

Parameter.Title: Energy reports
Parameter.Description: Energy level change which will result in sending a new energy report. 0 - energy reports disabled 1-255 (0.01-2.55 kWh) - report triggering threshold

Parameter.Title: Self-measurement
Parameter.Description: The Dimmer 2 may include active power and energy consumed by itself in reports sent to the main controller. 0 - Self-measurement inactive 1 - Self-measurement active

Parameter.Title: Method of calculating the active power
Parameter.Description: This parameter defines how to calculate active power. It is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive. NOTE:Parameter 58 is set to 0 after forced auto-calibration. 0 - measurement based on the standard algorithm 1 - approximation based on the calibration data 2 - approximation based on the control angle

Parameter.Title: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level
Parameter.Description: This parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level. NOTE: Parameter 59 works only when parameter 58 has a value other than 0. 0-500 (0-500W) - power consumed by the load at the maximum brightness level.
